page.title: 10ANDREW STEWART'S FACTORY
page.content: Each year Primary Seven children from both Howdenburn and Parkside are shown around this factory which produces high quality knitwear.The pupils receive prizes for the best booklet describing how the goods are made. The factory is beside the Jed at the Anna,and about 60 people work there. The yarn comes from Gala and Kinross both lambswool and cashmere are used.Jerseys,jumpers,cardigans and even jerkins are produced.Recently a machine was installed to do intarsia knitwear and produces three every half-hour. Finished goods go to Galashiels,the parent factory,for dispatch.Sweden and Germany are major buyers,also Holland, W.Germany and Eire. Extensions are nearly complete,using the former Tannery area.There will be new Offices as well.
